Question_1.Context: The study focuses on the development of a virus detection platform using liposome technology for innovative materials.
Question_1.Question: What is the purpose of embedding recombinant protein in liposomes in the study?
Question_1.A: To increase the stability of the protein
Question_1.B: To decrease the sensitivity of the detection method
Question_1.C: To reduce the binding affinity of the protein
Question_1.D: To prevent the detection of viruses
Question_1.Source: Therefore, our study suggests developing liposomes embedded in cell-derived ACE2 receptors as a platform that improves the stability and functionality of the ACE2 receptors to detect low concentrations of COVID-19 in real time.

Question_2.Context: The research involves the detection of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 using a sensor platform.
Question_2.Question: What is the detection limit for the S1 protein of both viruses using the sensor platform in the study?
Question_2.Source: With the sensor platform S1 protein of both viruses was detected with a detection limit of 10 pg/ml.

Question_3.Context: The study involves the detection of new emerging viruses using a sensor platform.
Question_3.Question: What was the result of the selectivity test between SARS-CoV-2 and MERS-CoV in the study?
Question_3.Source: In the selectivity test, MERS-CoV did not show a signal due to no binding with Au@R/Li.

Question_4.Context: The research involves the detection of spike proteins of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 using Au@R/Li.
Question_4.Question: What was the detection limit for SARS-CoV-2 spike protein using Au@R/Li in the study?
Question_4.Source: The detection wavelength of the SARS-CoV-1 and SARS-CoV-2 on Au@R/Li was significantly increased to 1.68 ~ 6.16-fold in 0.01 ~ 10,000 ng/ml concentration compared to Au@R. Also, the limit of detection of viruses on Au@R/Li was 0.01 ng/ml concentration.

Question_5.Context: The study involves the detection of clinical samples from COVID-19 patients using the LSPR sensor.
Question_5.Question: What was the accuracy of sensitivity for detecting SARS-CoV-2 in clinical samples using Au@R/Li?
Question_5.Source: The Au@R/Li shows a 98% accuracy of sensitivity according to the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve.

Question_6.Context: The research focuses on the development of a virus detection platform using liposome technology.
Question_6.Question: What was the purpose of using AuNPs in the study?
Question_6.A: To decrease the stability of the sensor platform
Question_6.B: To increase the sensitivity of the detection method
Question_6.C: To reduce the selectivity of the sensor platform
Question_6.D: To prevent the detection of viruses
Question_6.Source: Using nanomaterials has great advantages in applications targeting DNA, RNA, proteins, and other small ligands/molecules. LSPR biosensors with AuNPs have the advantage of being able to detect small analytes and have been successfully applied in clinical diagnostics.

Question_7.Context: The study involves the detection of spike proteins of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 using Au@R/Li.
Question_7.Question: What was the result of the selectivity test between SARS-CoV-2 and MERS-CoV in the study?
Question_7.Source: In the selectivity test, MERS-CoV did not show a signal due to no binding with Au@R/Li.

Question_8.Source: With the sensor platform S1 protein of both viruses was detected with a detection limit of 10 pg/ml.
